content: the emperor s bride socks pattern and photos tiina kuu the emperor s bride socks design was inspired by designs in augusta abrahamsson s embroidery book märkbok published in 1955 the socks are knitted toe up with a pin- striped gusset in the sole a round heel turn and a slipped stitch heel flap this is a revised and extended version of the original pattern first published in 2014 the pattern is titled keisarin morsian in finnish yarn and yardage main colour mc nurja merino sock 75% merino 25% nylon 420 m / 100 g 50-65 needles grams of black onyx colourway 2 0 mm / us0 and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable contrasting colour cc säie wool säie to obtain gauge circular needles at least 80 merino sock 75% merino 25% nylon 420 m / cm / 32 inches long 100 g 40-50 grams of light brown silver bliss socks can be knitted with dpns two shorter colourway circulars or a mini circular but the instructions have been written for magic loop any other fingering weight yarns can be used a distinct contrast between the colours is recommended to best show the delicate pattern size there are instructions for sizes small 64 sts and medium/large 72 sts which are referred to in the instructions as s m/l if only one gauge stitch count is given it applies to both sizes 36 sts and 36 row in stranded colourwork with the given gauge sizes s m/l fit foot pattern with larger needles = 10 cm / 4 inches circumference of approximately 18 5 21 cm / 7⅜ 8¼ inches with some negative ease before you start please read the instructions carefully the instep and front of the leg are worked on needle 1 the sole gussets heel and back of the leg are worked on needle 2 the emperor s bride socks page 1/7 instructions toe heel with mc and smaller needles cast on 20 24 the heel is worked back and forth on needle 2 sts in total using turkish or any other toe-up with mc switch to smaller needles if cast-on method of your choice there are now preferred 10 12 sts on each needle turn work and work a set-up row with mc on work the toe increases as follows the ws as described for each size round 1 knit set-up row size s if the first stitch is a mc round 2 on needle 1 work *k1 kfb knit until 2 stitch sl1 and p50 if the first stitch is a cc sts remain kfb k1* repeat * - * on needle 2 stitch p51 repeat rnds 1 and 2 until there are 32 36 sts on each needle there are now 64 72 sts in set-up row size m/l p59 total work the round heel turn back and forth foot and gusset starting on the rs as follows knit two rounds with mc one round with cc row 1 rs sl1 k32 k38
